thread.title: Justin Timberlake and Timbaland hit the studio together, and it’s getting us almost too excited, honestly
thread.title_full: Justin Timberlake and Timbaland hit the studio together, and it’s getting us almost too excited, honestly

author: Kenya Foy
title: Justin Timberlake and Timbaland hit the studio together, and it’s getting us almost too excited, honestly
text:
Justin Timberlake and Timbaland hit the studio together, and it’s getting us almost too excited, honestly Honestly, the last thing we want to do is start the week off with frazzled nerves (Monday blahs, ya know?), but this photo of Justin Timberlake and Timbaland in the studio together leaves us no choice but to get ridiculously excited and start biting our nails in the hopes that new music from Timberlake is coming in the near future. And by “near future,” we mean “before this decade is up.”
Srsly, “ Can’t Stop the Feeling ” is still an extremely catchy jam, and Timberlake’s tear-jerking “Trolls” song had us knee-deep in feels, but c’mon, JT! We’re starting to get more antsy by the minute. There’s only so many body rolls we can do 2013’s The 20/20 Experience , so the the progression of our dance moves depends on the arrival of your highly-anticipated new music.

via GIPHY 
Also, we cannot forget the fact that Timberlake agreed to do a Britney Spears collaboration (even though it might’ve been just a case of former flames being friendly). We have no evidence to support that potential musical reunion has gone any further than the two singers being all, “Yeah, we’re totally down to bring the 2000s back,” for the sake of riling up their fans, BUT this pic of Timberlake and Timbaland hard at work in the studio is concrete evidence of musical magic in the making.
The masters at work. @jtimberlake #timbaland #justintimberlake pic.twitter.com/hkSQozf7KP 
— Timbaland (@Timbaland) March 18, 2017 Since Timbaland and Timberlake have a history of producing hit songs together, we’re beyond positive that this new music will be worth the wait. But for the sake of our sanity, we hope it’s sooner rather than later.
